comments.raw_text: Per suggestion from Max, creating a general ticket to track performance issues for large number of products.  In my case, I have ~3000 products.
comments.creator: altlist@gmail.com
comments.text: Per suggestion from Max, creating a general ticket to track performance issues for large number of products.  In my case, I have ~3000 products.
comments.author: altlist@gmail.com

comments.text:
Maybe you could change the summary into 
"Bugzilla is slow when you have a very large number of products (>2500)".

We have ~150 products (and ~17000 bugs), which is for me already "many".  And we don't have real performance issues with bugzilla.

comments.text: Albert, do you see improvements since Bugzilla 4.2.1 compared to 4.2 or older?
comments.author: LpSolit@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Albert, do you see improvements since Bugzilla 4.2.1 compared to 4.2 or older?

comments.text:
Hi Frederic,

   I am at 4.0 but plan to upgrade to 4.4 later this year.  I did fold in bug 695514 into my 4.0 build which helps.

   But I make heavy use of the approach I noted in bug 740649.  That solved most of my performance issues, along with bug 537949, 

Albert
